channel.title: String conversion

item.title: String conversion
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

for(int i = 0; i < penguins.length; i++) { spawnNpc2(penguins[i][0], penguins[i][1], penguins[i][2], penguins[i][3], 0, 0, 0, 0); }

and make it into a fucking integer array.

Don’t claim you’re a “noob,” it takes a few seconds to look them up

Read full topic

@ravekitty wrote:

HcoJustin:

No, using strings requires a conversion. Using integers will just require a loop.

		for (int i = 0; i < Penguins.length; i++) {

I’m noob with datatypes.
What would I do with this DX

item.title: String conversion
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

How would I convert this

private final String[][] Penguins = {
                         //npcid, coordsX, coordsY, height
			{"8110","2742","3465","0"},
			{"8105","2847","3349","0"},
			{"8109","3478","3496","0"},
			{"8108","3240","3611","0"},
			{"8107","2445","3442","0"},
			{"8104","2988","3344","0"}
	};

To fit this method

public void spawnNpc2(int npcType, int x, int y, int heightLevel, int WalkingType, int HP, int maxHit, int attack, int defence) {
		 // first, search for a free slot
		 int slot = -1;
		 for (int i = 1; i < maxNPCs; i++) {
			 if (npcs[i] == null) {
				 slot = i;
				 break;
			 }
		 }
		 if(slot == -1) {
			 //Misc.println("No Free Slot");
			 return;		// no free slot found
		 }
		 NPC newNPC = new NPC(slot, npcType);
		 newNPC.absX = x;
		 newNPC.absY = y;
		 newNPC.makeX = x;
		 newNPC.makeY = y;
		 newNPC.heightLevel = heightLevel;
		 newNPC.walkingType = WalkingType;
		 newNPC.HP = HP;
		 newNPC.MaxHP = HP;
		 newNPC.maxHit = maxHit;
		 newNPC.attack = attack;
		 newNPC.defence = defence;
		 npcs[slot] = newNPC;
	 }

Read full topic
